metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9775 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The postrm script in the tomcat6 package before 6.0.45+dfsg-1~deb7u3 onDebian wheezy, before 6.0.45+dfsg-1~deb8u1 on Debian jessie, before6.0.35-1ubuntu3.9 on Ubuntu 12.04 LTS and on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS; the tomcat7package before 7.0.28-4+deb7u7 on Debian wheezy, before 7.0.56-3+deb8u6 onDebian jessie, before 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.8 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS, and on Ubuntu12.04 LTS, 16.04 LTS, and 16.10; and the tomcat8 package before8.0.14-1+deb8u5 on Debian jessie, before 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.3 on Ubuntu 16.04LTS, before 8.0.37-1ubuntu0.1 on Ubuntu 16.10, and before 8.0.38-2ubuntu1on Ubuntu 17.04 might allow local users with access to the tomcat accountto gain root privileges via a setgid program in the Catalina directory, asdemonstrated by /etc/tomcat8/Catalina/attack.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9775` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet3.0-java - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.3
libtomcat7-java - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.3
tomcat7 - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.3
tomcat7-admin - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.3
tomcat7-common - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.3
tomcat7-examples - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.3
tomcat7-user - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

libservlet2.5-java - 6.0.45+dfsg-1
No subscription required

libservlet3.1-java - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.3
libtomcat8-java - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.3
tomcat8 - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.3
tomcat8-admin - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.3
tomcat8-common - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.3
tomcat8-examples - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.3
tomcat8-user - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tomcat7 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.68-1ubuntu0.3').
tomcat6 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.0.45+dfsg-1').
tomcat8 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.32-1ubuntu1.3').
